comments.author: AB de Royse777
comments.body: 1. Your website looks like I am in a darknet site :-PIt's fine after all it's a mixer.2. Both clearnet and onion site loads fast. Especially the onion site loads faster than I had experience with any other sites.3. Maybe to start, have less service fees. You have few competition who are leading the industry, they have better fees rate than you. So as a new mixer at least a bit competitive will give you some advantage.Welcome to the forum.Good to see that you have already bought the copper membership and posted the graphical Ann. Most of the project owners are not aware of it. Now all you need to do is to promote the brand in the community. Consider running a signature campaign. Over time it will help you to build a positive image for your brand. There are many campaign managers who can help you to promote your brand in the forum. If you want then I can help you too. Feel free to check my service details and let's discuss if you find anything difficult to understand.Cheers,

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: mixerdream on December 30, 2022, 12:13:58 PMMixerdream.comWhat is your connection with [banned mixer] website? You partnered with them or what?I can see this was mentioned several times on your website and it can be found on the page bottom among your other links.You are offering higher fees than Jambler so I see no real advantage of using your service, and there are other mixers that charge less fees or even nothing.

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: How to test your service without using our own coins? You could provide a few bucks to willing members in order to test this out.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: I tried out the Mixerdream. The website design is pretty cool, nearly identical to what should be mixer. The interface is also fairly simple for all users, especially newcomers. They can easily obtain everything they require. My mix amount arrived on time and cannot be traced. So far, everything has gone pretty smoothly. Funds were received in less than 6 hours, which I believe should be improved. I know it's already on the website, but we'll be receiving mixed funds in 6 hours. However, I believe that time should be reduced further. Why should a user have to wait 6 hours to receive his funds? Everything else is fine to me. I hope you will consider user feedback to improve your service. I tried with min amount 0.005 BTC.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: mixerdream on December 30, 2022, 12:13:58 PMBest Anonymous Bitcoin mixerI've seen this exact same claim several times lately, and always from Newbies. You're in the trust business, don't make claims that aren't true.Quote from: The Cryptovator on January 07, 2023, 07:42:03 AMWhy should a user have to wait 6 hours to receive his funds?Because of blockchain analysis. Setting a fixed amount of time doesn't help much though.

comments.author: Kauyaz
comments.body: Precise mode doesn't work on Tor (with java disabled) because you've done that part with JavaScript, you can hide and show those fields with pure CSS. I see a lot of useless script in your code, it looks like jambler api copy/paste, you should rethink, remove them from the Tor version or at least offer a version without JavaScript.Precise mode fail on Tor Screenshot: https://i.postimg.cc/dkM6fbRy/tor.pngThe strange thing is that you use JS to show and hide fields and for navigation on clear and Tor version, which is totally unnecessary because you can do it with CSS, and then there are scripts in your code that are supposedly useless. It's like you want the user to enable java for no reason, which may seem suspicious to some users. It doesn't make sense, I recommend you change it.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: I'll tell you why I wouldn't use your service. First of all, you say you can provide absolute privacy, which is not true. There's no such thing as absolute privacy, which gives me the impression that you haven't studied your subject well.You're expensive. The mixer I have in my signature charges me nothing to use.You're new. Appearing out of nowhere and making such ambiguous statements doesn't make me trust you.You use Google adwords in your clearnet website, and I don't understand why. Don't you already charge for mixing? Why showing advertisements too? Do you know that Google is a spying company, completely the opposite of a mixer's mission?You're interacting with another service (Jambler) and I don't understand why.You have a Telegram bot, which isn't very privacy-respecting practice to use.Your main page looks like it was written within 2 hours. (and you've also spelled things wrong, like "blickchain")Giving the money back, after 6 hours isn't going to help obfuscating the activity.
